availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert H. Johnson (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and laborer.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sophia Spratt Johnson. Father of Thomas Johnson, William Johnson, George Johnson, Elijah Johnson, Nancy J. Johnson, Henry Johnson, and Robert Johnson. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Convicted of committing mayhem against Sophia Johnson in Trigg Circuit Court. Inmate of the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort, Kentucky, from October 9, 1858, to December 21, 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 398A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton Division, p. 28.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 284.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994029, Caldwell County Births.
Record of Prisoners, Kentucky State Penitentiary, Corrections Cabinet, Series 03615, KDLA, Volume: 1855-1861.
KYR-0001-020-0255.
